question: Glucoraphanin from broccoli can help reduce obesity , yes or no?
ideal_answer: Yes, there is evidence that glucoraphanin from broccoli can help reduce obesity.

snippets.text: Glucoraphanin: a broccoli sprout extract that ameliorates obesity-induced inflammation and insulin resistance.

A recent study demonstrated that glucoraphanin, a precursor of the Nrf2 activator sulforaphane, ameliorates obesity by enhancing energy expenditure and browning of white adipose tissue, and attenuates obesity-related inflammation and insulin resistance by polarizing M2 macrophages and reducing metabolic endotoxemia.
Thus, this review focuses on the efficiency and safety of glucoraphanin in alleviating obesity, insulin resistance, and NAFLD.
